task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, then move above the red plate and place the white plate onto it, finally retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A stationary xArm manipulator must pick a white plate from the tabletop and place it onto a nearby red plate/disc. The contact sheet shows approach to the white plate, grasping near its rim/top, transfer toward the red plate, placement, and retreat. The tree uses perception to localize both plates, a top grasp strategy, precise alignment before grasping, and a cautious descent with contact detection before releasing. Timeouts are moderate to tolerate minor delays, and a short wait after retreat stabilizes the scene.
preconditions: White plate and red plate visible within reachable area
Gripper operational and empty at start
stepwise_plan: Perceive the white plate and open gripper.
Approach above the white plate and compute a top grasp.
Align precisely and pick the plate; verify grasp stability.
Perceive the red plate and move above it.
Descend until contact, then release the plate onto the red plate.
success_criteria: White plate placed centered/flush on the red plate
Gripper opens and retreats without disturbing placement
failure_and_recovery: If object not detected, repeat detection or adjust view (not shown, manual).
If grasp unstable, reattempt pick after re-aligning.
If contact not detected during placing, cap descent by timeout and retry.
task_long_description.termination: End after successful release on red plate and a brief retreat+wait.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper engaged with the white plate near rim/top indicating the grasp moment.
frame_3.predicts_next: Transfer toward the red plate is expected after securing the grasp.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Detect the red plate for placement.
Controlled descent until contact with red plate.
Back off from the placement area.

failure_modes: White plate not detected due to glare/occlusion
Red plate not localized; placement off-target
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection with slight view change (not encoded).
Re-align then retry pick if stability fails.
Abort descent on timeout and re-approach the red plate.
Open gripper only after contact to avoid drop.
assumptions: Frames appear to show top/rim grasp then movement toward a red disc; exact place pose not explicitly computed, so placement uses contact-based lowering.
Orientation constraints are not visible; top grasp chosen.
Visual evidence is consistent with pick-then-place; slight occlusions exist in later frames.

expected_success_criteria: Plate rests on red plate after release
